00023 #include <stdio.h> /* printf */
00024 #include <string.h> /*string */
00025 #include <fcntl.h> /* O_CREAT etc */
00026 #include <linux/errno.h> /* error codes */
00027 #include <sys/ioctl.h> /*ioctl() */
00028 #include <sys/stat.h> /* S_IWUSR etc */
00029 #include "selectmapInterface.h"
00030 #include "virtex_io.h" /* ioctl commands */
00031 
00032 #define SM_REG_WRITE 0
00033 #define SM_REG_READ 1
00034 
00035 static int g_SmFile;
00036 
00037 #ifndef DCSC_TEST
00038 const char* g_pDefaultSmDevice="/dev/virtex";
00039 #else //DCSC_TEST
00040 const char* g_pDefaultSmDevice="/tmp/virtex";
00041 #endif //DCSC_TEST
00042 
00043 int initSmAccess(const char* pDeviceName)
00044 {
00045     int iResult=0;
00046     const char* pDevice;
00047     int flags = O_RDWR;
00048     int mode = 0;
00049 
00050     // open default or specified device 
00051     if (pDeviceName)
00052         pDevice=pDeviceName;
00053     else
00054         pDevice=g_pDefaultSmDevice;
00055     /* checking for actual device or pseudo-device (file) */
00056     if (strncmp(pDevice, "/dev/", 4 != 0)) {
00057         flags |= O_CREAT; //create the file
00058         mode = S_IRUSR|S_IWUSR|S_IRGRP|S_IWGRP; //setting file mode
00059     }       
00060     fprintf(stderr, "initialize selectmap access interface: device %s\n", pDevice);
00061     // opening..
00062     g_SmFile = open(pDevice, flags, mode);
00063 
00064     if (g_SmFile > 0)
00065         iResult = 0;
00066     else
00067         iResult = -ENOENT;
00068     
00069     return iResult;
00070 }
00071 
00072 int releaseSmAccess()
00073 {
00074     int iResult=0;
00075     fprintf(stderr, "release selectmap access interface\n");
00076     iResult = close(g_SmFile);
00077     return iResult;
00078 }
00079 
00080 __u32 smMakeT1Header(__u8 rdwr, __u16 address, __u16 words)
00081 {
00082     /* checking type, either 0 (write) or 1 (read) */
00083     if (rdwr > 1)
00084         return -EINVAL; //Invalid argument
00085     /* checking address, max 14 bits */
00086     if (address&(0x3<<14))
00087         return -EINVAL;
00088     /* checking words, max 2^11-1 (2047) */
00089     if (words > 2047)
00090         return -EINVAL;
00091 
00092     /* putting together header */
00093     unsigned long int hdr = 0;
00094     hdr |= (1<<29); /* type 1*/
00095     hdr |= (1<<(rdwr?27:28)); /* if rd;27.bit, wr;28.bit */
00096     hdr |= (address<<13);
00097     hdr |= words;
00098     return hdr;
00099 }
00100 
00101 
00102 __u32 smMakeT2Header(__u8 rdwr, __u32 words)
00103 {
00104     if (rdwr > 1)
00105         return 0;
00106     
00107     /* max 2^27-1 words */
00108     if (words > 134217727)
00109         return 0;
00110 
00111     /* putting together header */   
00112     __u32 hdr = 0;
00113     hdr |= (2<<29); /* type 2 */
00114     hdr |= (1<<(rdwr?27:28));
00115     hdr |= words;   
00116     return hdr;
00117 }
00118 
00119 __u32 smMakeFacHeader(__u8 ba, __u8 mja, __u8 mna)
00120 {
00121     /* checking type, either 0 (write) or 1 (read) */
00122     if (ba > 2)
00123         return 0;
00124     
00125     /* putting together header */
00126     __u32 hdr = 0;
00127     hdr |= (ba << 25);
00128     hdr |= (mja << 17);
00129     hdr |= (mna << 9);  
00130     return hdr;
00131 }
00132 
00133 
00134 
00135 int smRegisterWrite(__u32 address, __u32 pData)
00136 {
00137     int iResult=0;
00138     address = smMakeT1Header(SM_REG_WRITE, address, 1);
00139     if (iResult < 0) {
00140         fprintf(stderr, "invalid type 1 packet header, aborting write.\n");
00141         return iResult;
00142     }
00143     iResult = ioctl(g_SmFile, VIRTEX_SET_REG, address);
00144     iResult = ioctl(g_SmFile, VIRTEX_WRITE_REG, pData); //have to send the value here, error if just the pointer is sent, unknown why.
00145     return iResult;
00146 }
00147 
00148 int smRegisterRead(__u32 address, __u32 *pData)
00149 {
00150     int iResult=0;
00151     *pData = smMakeT1Header(SM_REG_READ, address, 1);
00152 
00153     iResult = ioctl(g_SmFile, VIRTEX_READ_REG, pData);
00154     iResult = 1;
00155     
00156     return iResult;
00157 }
